description: Through reading texts of Plato (Socrates), Aristotle, Augustine and Aquinas, the student encounters a range of political ideas deeply challenging to--and possibly corrosive of--today's dominant democratic liberalism. Can classical and medieval thinking offer insight into modern impasses in political morality? Is such ancient thinking plausible, useful, or dangerous?
name: ANCIENT POLITICAL THOUGH

values.comments:
The evaluations for this course were extremely positive, praising Dr. Norton for her entertaining lecturing style and great teaching, leaving many students wishing Dr. Norton also taught a follow-up course. Numerous students claimed they would like to take more courses with Dr. Norton in the future, with one even saying Dr. Norton “may have changed my life.”
*Note: Less than 25% of students submitted written evaluations for this class
